ai.summary: Lea Valley Walk is a 15.9 km long-distance trail in the UK that tracks along the River Lea, blending urban riverside paths with rural sections. Classified as hard, the route demands a sustained effort, good footwear, and navigation through varied surfaces.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly towpath and riverside paths with some dirt tracks and occasional grassy sections. Expect flat to gently rolling terrain, but the length and occasional mud after rain, plus busy urban segments near towns, contribute to a challenging overall experience.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long day and check weather and route conditions in advance. Carry sufficient water and snacks, wear sturdy footwear, and bring a map or offline navigation. Be cautious near water edges, locks, and busy roads; stay on official paths where indicated. Let someone know your plans, and carry a charged phone with emergency contacts.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing and a packable waterproof jacket
Map, guidebook, or offline map on your phone
Lightweight rain jacket or packable rain cover
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) offers the best daylight and drier conditions; the route can be tackled year-round with extra planning for cold or wet weather.
